relation: Great for these types of students
You will have to research the different clubs. There are many activities on campus.
Great for all types and ages of students
Very inexpensive to attend. You will need to save as much as possible now, so that you can go on to earn higher degrees later.
Plenty of places to go in downtown Louisville.
Good and bad instructors. Check rate my professor or check with others before choosing your classes.

Make sure you don't take more credit hours per semester than you can handle. Take advantage of online classes that are offered thru blackboard. Attend an orientation so that you will know what to expect.
Very inexpensive to attend this college. I highly recommend earning you associates degree here. You can transfer to the school of your choice to complete your education.

textAfterTable: Great for these types of students Jefferson Community and Technical College has a wide range of students and is great for anyone. Different personalities and interests will not effect the relationships that you develop on campus, nor the things that you learn. Tips for prospective students Do not be afraid to speak to those around you. Jefferson is not similar to other schools in that you do not have all of these traditional students around judging you for the person that you are. Friends can be found in a variety of walks of life if only you open up a little. Also, do not be afraid to talk to your professors about problems that you are having. Most of them have taught at other schools and are at Jefferson for the friendly, community feel. They really are there to help you, not just as the cliche used for every school declares. Bang for the buck The cost is $125 per credit hour, and there is no housing so there is no cost for that as well as food. You can take as many credit hours as you desire, so you yourself can determine how much you pay. There is also great financial aid available that makes it even easier to go to school here. Am enjoying being here
